Class ALU

  • java.lang.Object
    • ALU

  • public class ALU
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates the arithmetic and logic unit (ALU) of a processor. Follows the ARMv8 architecture, with the exception of the number of bits used for input and output values. Uses the BINARY_LENGTH constant from the Binary class as the nubmer of bits for inputs and output. The ALU must be implemented using logic operations (AND, OR, NOT) on each set of input bits because the goal of this assignment is to learn about how a computer processor uses logic gates to perform arithmetic. The Java arithmetic operations should not be used in this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ALU()
      Constructor initializes inputs and output to random binary values, intializes all control bits to true, initializes zero flag to false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ALU

        public ALU()
        Constructor initializes inputs and output to random binary values, intializes all control bits to true, initializes zero flag to false. Inputs and output arrays should have the length of the BINARY_LENGTH constant from the Binary class. Control array is length 4 bits.

    • Method Detail

      • setInputA

        public void setInputA(boolean[] b)
        Sets the value of inputA.
        Parameters:
        b - The value to set inputA to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array b does not have length Binary.BINARY_LENGTH

      • setInputB

        public void setInputB(boolean[] b)
        Sets the value of inputB.
        Parameters:
        b - The value to set inputB to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array b does not have length Binary.BINARY_LENGTH

      • setControl

        public void setControl(int c)
        Sets the value of the control line to one of the following values. Note that we are not implementing all possible control line values. 0 for AND; 1 for OR; 2 for ADD; 6 for SUBTRACT; 7 for PASS INPUT B.
        Parameters:
        c - The value to set the control to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if c is not 0, 1, 2, 6, or 7.

      • getOutput

        public boolean[] getOutput()
        Returns a copy of the value in the output.
        Returns:
        The value in the output

      • getZeroFlag

        public boolean getZeroFlag()
        Returns the value of the zero data member. The zero data member should have been set to true if the result of the operation was zero.
        Returns:
        The value of the zeroFlag data member

      • getCarryFlag

        public boolean getCarryFlag()
        Returns the value of the carryFlag data member. The carryFlag data member is set to true if the ALU addition operation has a carry out of the most significant bit.
        Returns:
        The value of the carryFlag data member

      • getOverflowFlag

        public boolean getOverflowFlag()
        Returns the value of the overflowFlag data member. The overflowFlag data member is set to true if the ALU addition operation has a result that is overflow when the operands are signed integers.
        Returns:
        The value of the overflowFlag data member

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Activates the ALU so that the ALU performs the operation specified by the control data member on the two input values. When this method is finished, the output data member contains the result of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the control data member is not set to a valid operation code.
